column1: To the west lie the Santa Cruz Mountains. The city was named for these
column2: which separate it from the Pacific Ocean. To the east lies the Diablo Range. The two ranges demarcate the Santa Clara Valley.

column1: Mountain View has a warm-summer Mediterranean climate (Köppen climate classification Csb: dry-summer subtropical). Summers are warm and dry
column2: while winters are mild and wet. However
column3: both summers and winters are somewhat moderated due to its relative proximity to the Pacific
column4: although it has a lesser maritime influence than San Francisco further north on the peninsula.

column1: Mountain View is one of the major cities that make up Silicon Valley
column2: and has many notable Silicon Valley companies either headquartered there or with a large presence. As of 2018
column3: major tech companies such as Google and Mozilla were headquartered in Mountain View. In 2018
column4: the comparison site CareerBliss ranked the city number 1 in the United States on its list of Happiest Cities to Work for 2018.After voting to increase the minimum wage incrementally in 2015
column5: in December 2017
column6: the Mountain View City Council implemented a mandatory $15 minimum wage
column7: to apply to employees who work two or more hours a week. At the start of 2018
column8: Mountain View raised its minimum wage to $15.00. Starting on January 1
column10: the minimum wage will be "adjusted annually based on the San Francisco-Oakland-San Jose regional Consumer Price Index."  A proposal to slow down the rate of the wage increases by a year was defeated in a City Council meeting on December 4
column14: it was announced that Mountain View's minimum wage would rise to $15.65 on January 1
column16: with the increase delayed by one year for companies with 25 or fewer employees. As of Jan. 2020
column17: the minimum wage in Mountain View is $16.05/hr.

column1: Mountain View has a council-manager government system. An executive city manager is in charge of several departments
column2: while the city council
column5: and committees
column6: is the legislature responsible for the ordinances of the city code. The executive in turn enforces the code and promulgates administrative regulations to execute it. The city clerk and attorney perform supporting roles. The Community Development Department is the agency responsible for planning and zoning.

column1: Mountain View has a pedestrian-friendly downtown centered on Castro Street. The downtown area consists of the seven blocks of Castro Street from the Downtown Mountain View Station transit center in the north to the intersection with El Camino Real in the south. The transit center links the Caltrain commuter rail and Santa Clara Valley Transportation Authority (VTA) light rail and bus systems.
Four blocks with a concentration of restaurants
column2: cafes
column3: and shops extend south from the downtown station. The Michelin Guide-starred restaurant Chez TJ is located a block from Castro Street on Villa Street. Tied House
column5: was one of the first brewpubs in the Bay Area
column6: and was a popular stop in downtown until it closed in 2019.

column1: The core of downtown is the plaza shared by City Hall
column2: the Mountain View Center for the Performing Arts (MVCPA) and the Mountain View Public Library. The plaza is used for many community gatherings and events
column3: and features a collection of public art. Peninsula Youth Theatre and TheatreWorks are among the home companies of the MVCPA. The City Hall and MVCPA complex
column4: designed by William Turnbull of San Francisco
column5: opened in 1991. Behind those buildings is Pioneer Park
column6: formerly the site of Mountain View's first cemetery.The Mountain View Police Department is located two blocks away from Castro Street on Villa Street.Since 1971
column7: the city has held the annual Mountain View Art & Wine Festival on Castro Street by closing down the street to traffic for two days. There is a farmers' market in the Caltrain parking lot every Sunday morning. Every summer
column9: the city celebrates Thursday Night Live by closing off Castro street to cars and providing live music events and car shows on Castro Street.
